Title: Pixar and Walt Disney's Fourth Movie
Review:
Finding Nemo is the fourth movie that Pixar and Walt Disney have created. The movie was directed by Andrew Stanton and Lee Unkrich. Finding Nemo is a story about a father, Marlin (voice of Albert Brooks) and his son, Nemo (voice of Alexander Gould).

As the movie opens, Marlin and his wife are staring at their unborn children. Suddenly a large predator fish appears. As they try to protect their children, Marlin is knocked unconscious and is unable to protect his family. When he awakes, he discovers that his wife and children are gone except for one egg. As the story progresses, it shows that that one egg has grown and is named Nemo. Adventure and new experiences is what Nemo longed for. It was hard to satisfy his urges because of his overprotective father always worried that he was in danger. One day while playing dare with his friends, Nemo ventures too close to a boat and is captured by one of the divers. His father tries to save him, but is too late and the journey of Finding Nemo begins.

The critical intentions of the writers and directors of the film were to show that always trying to protect your children can do more harm than good. They also show that the love for a child is strong and powerful thing which pushed Marlin to find his son regardless of the dangers or obstacles that would stand in his way.

Things I liked about the movie were the animation, everything looked real and vibrant, and the appeal of the characters especially Dory who puts a comical twist to the movie. I also enjoyed when the angel fish in the tank, Gill, who taught Nemo a lesson that he couldn't let his deformed fin hold him back from taking risk. Though I thought it to be a little sad when in the beginning of the movie Nemos mother dies. The movie its self I thought to be very cute. I am looking forward to the next Pixar and Walt Disney movie that is produced.

Title: Heartwarming
Review:
I'll be totally honest and confirm to you that everything what they say about this movie is true. It's a brilliantly animated masterpiece with lots of humor that actually works and a plot that really brings tears to your eyes from time to time. The modern artists of Pixar never cease to amaze the audience in expanding their horizons. Finding Nemo is visually stunning and you can have nothing but respect for the people who created it.

I was more or less skeptic about watching it, because it was so overhyped ! Two days before it got released in my country, the TV and press loudly announced that the DVD broke all records in the USA during its first release-day. That's usually a sign of being typically mainstream and fake...but Finding Nemo is not. I'm allergic to fake sentiment and pathetic feel-good movies but I was really touched by this one. The moral and valuable life lessons are always present, but they're not shoved down your throat or thrown in your face all the time. This movie really relativates itself and that's important for a good comedy. And it's hilarious !!! Every side character in Finding Nemo (and there are a LOT of them) is exceptional and worth a mention. And the voices are cast perfectly as well...like the voice of Willem Dafoe for Gill, for example...a perfect choice. The character of Dory ( speaks through the voice of Ellen DeGeneres ) steals the show. She's an adorable blue fish who suffers from amnesia. She forgets what she's doing or going to every five minutes and that really leads to hilarious situations.

Movies like this aren't just being made for children exclusive... They're good for everyone to realize you have to entertain yourself from time to time and just to enjoy the little things in life. I recommend this to everyone in the world. No matter if you're 9 or 99 years old, Finding Nemo will bring a smile on your face and leave behind a warm feeling in your heart.

Title: how cinematic and dramatic elements bring out its literary elements
Review: There are a number of ways that the cinematic and literary elements bring out the literary elements in "Finding Nemo." The scenery helps the viewer to identify that it is set in an ocean by using reefs and various types of fish and sharks along with the water. The lighting also helps this by the way that it shines through the water. It was kind of milky looking. Sound effects also helped the setting because there were sounds of fishes swimming through the water and engines from boats. Music helped to set the tone at various points throughout the movie by playing happy music when a great event has occured, sad music when something bad occured, and ominous sounding music when the viewer is supposed to not be sure about the outcome of a specific event. Dialogue was a huge factor in this film. Without it, there would be little symbolism, the plot would be unclear, and the character's traits would be a bit murky. In the dialogue, the characters uttered common sayings such as "I'm glad I got that off my chest," which means a problem had been solved, and they also talked about the glass being half full or half empty dilemma which was to symbolize who was the optimist and the pessimist. This was brought up when Dorrie and Marlon were trapped in the whale and the water was going down in the whale's mouth. Dorrie said that the mouth was half full, and Marlon said that it was half empty. Another type of symbolism also occured in the whale when Marlon asked "How do I taste, Moby?" That was in reference to Moby Dick, a play in which one of the main characters was a whale. Dialogue also played a huge part in helping the viewer characterize the characters. Marlon was always saying stuff to Nemo like "You're not going to be able to get out of there yourself," and he said to Dorrie that she could not speak whale. This led the viewer to characterize Marlon as an overprotective, negative father. Dorrie and Nemo, on the other hand, were always saying comments like "Yes, I can," and "Just let me do this!" This would help to characterize them as the exact opposite of Marlon- they were positive and not overbearing. Dialogue also helped the plot to advance in the movie. In the beginning, Nemo and his dad were on the way to school and they were talking about meeting sharks and sea turtles and wondering how old sea turtles were. Marlon said that he would ask the sea turtle for his age after he met the shark, and he ended up meeting both later in the film while he was looking for Nemo. Dialogue also helped the theme because it was a positive theme, and Dorrie and Nemo and other fish were always positive.

Title: Finding Nemo
Review:
The movie "Finding Nemo"takes place under the coral reef of the open sea water. A clownfish named Marlin lives with his son Nemo and he tells his son about how dangerous it is in the ocean. Nemo is captured by humans and his father Marvin has to go and rescue him. He is so worried that he doesn't know what is going to happen to his only son.  The genre is an adventure comedy for families.

        Nemo sets off into the ocean sea and explores what is around him. He then is abducted by humans and is netted up and taken away to the dentist office in Sydney. Meanwhile Marlin notices that Nemo has disappeared and is nowhere to be found. Marlin meets a fish named Dory who has a short term memory loss. They both travel a very big distance to search for Nemo and soon meet up with sharks, turtles and other sea creatures. While this is happening Nemo and his friends in the tank try to leave the area to go back to their original home.

          In the movie it shows how each of the characters are acting like. At first the movie starts really great because it shows how Nemo didn't want to go to the first day of school and his other friends were begging for him to come with them and they sounded so excited which make them look really cute. Another part that I liked in the movie was when Marlin felt so scared when he had lost his son. I can feel of how his father felt at that time because it's a father-son relationship. Marlin showed that he really cared for Nemo instead of just saying "oh i don't care its whatever he'll come back eventually". There was one part where I disliked of how Dory was asked if she seen a boat gone by. Even though she has short term memory she could have just said she didn't see anything instead of playing and joking around with Marlin. Dory says " oh I seen a boat it went this way no it went this way", I felt like she wanted to make Marlin feel more worried instead of telling him that she didn't see anything which is really rude.

          The photography in this movie is a dark background in some parts of the movie but there is also light in the movie too. I think that the photography is really great because it creates a mood where it's a calm and peaceful place. You can always see the sea creatures that are moving around the water, which makes the picture looks so beautiful. At the end of the movie, the picture shows that it's in the city and shows the people nature and the seagulls that are flying everywhere. This kind of photography makes the scene more attractive and would make the audience have a good feeling because it wouldn't be a boring scene.

         

        My overall reaction to this movie is that it is such a great movie! I recommend this movie for everyone to watch because it's an adventurous family movie. The world of Finding Nemo is such a pure and simple movie, with cute creatures that live under the ocean,and having lots of fun playing with each other. The music and theme also blend, very well with the movie. This movie shows a father and son relationship which would make little kids feel they should care about their loved ones and know that they are protected and never harmed. As a final thought, watching this movie with a family will absolutely make everyone smile and end the day with a warm feeling. I truly give this movie a rate 10/10!!!!

Title: Dory is the best!
Review: When I knew that Disney is going to stop making animated films such as Peter Pan or Aladdin, and that is going to make only films with Pixar (computer, computer, computer...), I felt sad. Disney has been with me since I was 3 or 4 and it's a pity that the great designers who work there stop doing such masterpieces. But if you see 'Finding Nemo' everything changes. I think I've never seen a film as good as this is. It's incredible how perfect the ocean and all its animals are designed: the vegetarian sharks (I love Bruce when he smells the blood!), Nemo and his father, the teacher Ray and all his pupils or the little octopus who loses ink. If you watch this film, you'll laugh, you'll feel like crying and you won't want to eat fish never in your life (at least in my case). The first thing I've said, laughing, is the biggest part of the film. In my opinion, Dory would win an Oscar for making me laugh without stopping when she starts to speak whale language or because of her loss of memory. According to the moving moments, what happens at the beginning would make anyone cry, it's very sad. And the most moving scene for me is when there are fishermen in a ship, at the end . And that's why I don't want to eat fish again!! I'm not going to say anything, just watch it! I recommend everybody to do it. You won't lose your time, trust me!!

"Finding Nemo" is a wonderful animated adventure movie that simply is irresistible for young as well as older persons.

The most excellent thing about "Finding Nemo" is the perfect timing, just like in "Monsters, Inc" the jokes are extremely well placed in a quick pace and are good for more then just a few laughs.

Title: Pixar Magic at its Best
Review:
Finding Nemo is an animated film that adds on to the list of masterpieces created by Pixar. Although the movie is known for its humorous characters, comedic scenes, and terrific underwater animation, Finding Nemo provides emotional insight to both children and adults of what is most important in lifeâ€”family.

What separates Finding Nemo from most animated films is the fact that it doesn't connect to just children; it is a movie in which the entire family can enjoy and learn something from. Looking at Marlin (father of Nemo), this movie can relate to adults in that it highlights the clichÃ© quote of "never give up" as an extremely important motto to live off by, especially when speaking about something that is very important to you. When looking at Nemo, children are able to realize that during a struggle, it is important to stay positive in order to succeed and receive something good out of a situation. By attracting and connecting to people of all ages, this is why Finding Nemo was not only one of the highest-grossing animated films of all time, but also THE best-selling DVD of all time.

The producers of Finding Nemo also did an excellent job in choosing the voices for the characters. Dory, another main character, plays a quirky fish who adds a vital role in the comedy part of the movie. Choosing Ellen DeGeneres, a well known comedian and talk show host, as the voice for Dory adds to the brilliance of the movie because Ellen is a natural entertainer. Andrew Stanton, the writer and director of Finding Nemo, played the voice of "Crush," a sea turtle Marlin encountered during his journey. With Crush's "surfer dude" voice and personality, he adds another source of humor in the movie with his unique qualities.

The ocean is vast and very mysterious. Finding Nemo lets you see what lies below the water with brilliant colors and overwhelming sense of detail. It truly reveals that there is a whole new world that exists in our planet. It not only provides views of underwater landscapes from within the ocean, but also the fish tank setting from a fish's point of view. The vibrant colors and the amount of detail put into this animation is another reason why so many people have been drawn to this movie.

Finding Nemo is more than just a movie about a father fish who loses his beloved son and his journey to find him. The audience is truly drawn into the storyline of the movie because of Marlin's persistent determination and Nemo's lovable and impressionable personality. It allows the viewers to connect emotionally to these two main characters because of the strong bond they have with each other. The movie strongly emphasizes the devotion and enduring love a parent has for his child, and the importance of these qualities during times of complications. Because of this, it shows the reason why family is among the most important things to cherish and have in your life because they are the ones who go through great risks for one another.

The meaning behind the story line, humorous scenes, amount of detail, and unique characters make being disappointed at any time during the movie impossible. It is a film that the whole family will enjoy no matter how old you are. Whether it's watching it during class or at home, I will always be just as excited to watch this wonderful film as I was the first time I watched it in theaters nine years ago.

Title: Cute movie
Review:
The movie "Finding Nemo" is a adorable, funny movie for kids and adults alike. The actors are great and and the animation looks some what realistic with the shimmering water. The movie. It takes you on an adventure through the ocean, showing a dad's love for his son.

The actors are good and bring more life into the movie. Ellen Degeneres plays Dory, who is a fish that forgets every five minutes and is very friendly.Dory "Hey there, Mr. Grumpy Gills, when life gets you down do you wanna know what you've gotta do?".She befriends Marlin, played by Alex Brooks, he is an overprotective dad that's son has been kidnapped by humans. Both of these actors' characters contrast, which makes the movie funny and enjoyable to watch as the change for the better and become friends.

In Addition, the scenery in the movie looks amazing for animation. It captures the realistic look of the ocean even though its animated. In the first scene Marlin shows his wife Cory, who is only there for a short time, their new home over looking the coral reef. The water shimmers showing the beauty of the ocean.

Although, this is a great movie they could show coral a little more instead of taking her out right away. Maybe Marlin could remember her and let her go, because in about the fist couple of minutes it shows them together in there in home and then she gets taken out of the movie altogether.

Furthermore, this movie is good for kids and adults. It's not to scary like some movies are for kids now, and its funny and also serious. Adults can get bored in movies that are made for kids, but this movie doesn't bore you. It can make you laugh, when Dory forgets things. It shows the characters changing throughout the movie. Henceforth, the movies characters are cute and and there are some sad parts but there are also happy and funny parts. The scary parts in this movie are not to scary and don't scare your kids. Thus, this movie is a great movie for you and your kids.

Accordingly, this is over all a great movie to watch. In the future this would be a good movie to remember, because the style of movies is going to change. Would you want your children to watch something that could scare them or give them nightmares or maybe they just don't enjoy it? If you don't want that to happen, "Finding Nemo" is a good movie to watch.

Title: Best Pixar film I've seen
Review:
This movie is one of the best I've seen. It managed to be entertaining and hilarious all the way through. Ellen DeGeneres makes a great Dory and Nicholas Bird's cute voice is just perfect for Squirt. And you gotta admire how they used real Aussie actors for parts such as the sharks (I hate fake accents). It's an entertaining, hilarious, amily film (and you don't have to have a family to enjoy it!) I think it deserved the Oscar. The DVD commentary is amusing and informational(unlike "it was great working with this person" crap).It includes an audio track and some nice visual commentary. Anyways, its a clever CGI picture. 10/10

Title: warning: SPOILER - I liked it, despite the odd lesson being taught...
Review:
I'll be totally honest and confirm to you that everything what they say about this movie is true. It's a brilliantly animated masterpiece with lots of humor that actually works and a plot that really brings tears to your eyes from time to time. The modern artists of Pixar never cease to amaze the audience in expanding their horizons. Finding Nemo is visually stunning and you can have nothing but respect for the people who created it.

I was more or less skeptic about watching it, because it was so overhyped ! Two days before it got released in my country, the TV and press loudly announced that the DVD broke all records in the USA during its first release-day. That's usually a sign of being typically mainstream and fake...but Finding Nemo is not. I'm allergic to fake sentiment and pathetic feel-good movies but I was really touched by this one. The moral and valuable life lessons are always present, but they're not shoved down your throat or thrown in your face all the time. This movie really relativates itself and that's important for a good comedy. And it's hilarious !!! Every side character in Finding Nemo (and there are a LOT of them) is exceptional and worth a mention. And the voices are cast perfectly as well...like the voice of Willem Dafoe for Gill, for example...a perfect choice. The character of Dory ( speaks through the voice of Ellen DeGeneres ) steals the show. She's an adorable blue fish who suffers from amnesia. She forgets what she's doing or going to every five minutes and that really leads to hilarious situations.

Movies like this aren't just being made for children exclusive... They're good for everyone to realize you have to entertain yourself from time to time and just to enjoy the little things in life. I recommend this to everyone in the world. No matter if you're 9 or 99 years old, Finding Nemo will bring a smile on your face and leave behind a warm feeling in your heart.

Title: Finding Nemo is a children's action that should keep their attention!
Review:
A good movie for both kids and adults. It kept my attention and I didn't see that there was anything that would be inappropriate for children. The movie contains a lot of familiar voices that I recognized and a few that I didn't recognize. All the characters were cute and lovable. You might have to explain the difference between Marlin and Nemo to small children, there is a small difference, but it was hard to tell, even for me. There were a bunch of adorable little tag lines like, "Fish are friends not food." "Ride some shell." This is definitely one that should go in the DVD collection at home or in a daycare!

Title: baguiras
Review:
"What many people consider to be witty and original is what I see as imports from early Chaplin films and episodes of the Simpsons. Finding Nemo is the story of the eponymous fish, Nemo. Nemo is the only survivor of his batch after his brothers and sisters (along with his Mother) were eaten by sharks in the egg stage. However Nemo survived (albeit deformed) along with a paranoid Father.

The jokes seem tired and lack any moments of stomach-rumbling chuckling but rather a series of humoured snorts. Although the main character of Nemo is likable, the other two major characters are not. Ellen Degeneres' role as Dory is so irritating that you start hoping the diver comes back and batters Dory then at least somebody will get some use out of the poorly-designed character.

Although there are smart ideas it becomes jumbled up in overly-immature jokes that decrease the entertainment value. For example the sharks that are dedicated to soothing their blood lust is worth some giggles but it gets lost in the sea(pardon the pun) of poor remarks. I should have known that the immaturity and basicness of the jokes would never stop coming. I assumed there would be a 15 minute farting sequence later on."

Title: excellent movie.. the best.
Review:
was an excellent movie, only thing that ruined it was the American accents of the turtles, where as everything else wasn't. but i love the movie all the same.. its my favourite. xx

i loved the graphics of this movie.. very precise as is most of Disney/pixar movies.

Dory was a great character.. wouldn't have been as funny if she was played as a man like it was planned to.

And the director did the right thing by not putting another scene in about nemo learning how to swim with gill.. it would have been too long.

Don't make another movie, because it will just spoil the first one.

Title: Pretty Good
Review:
This move is very good! It is definitely a great film for the family to watch together before the kids go to bed! You will all get a good laugh out of this film! And if you guys are worried it is absolutely 100% child approved! I also like this film a lot because the personalities of the characters in this film are a lot like the personalities that people we know have! It is a pretty good movie just to sit back laugh, and enjoy what's happening on the screen without having to stay on high-alert for something scary that the children won't like! Again I completely recommend this film for something that a family could watch together!

Title: Adore this movie
Review:
I absolutely love Finding Nemo! One of the best animated movies i've seen. The theme of trust is very good. I like that marlin really has to learn to trust not just nemo but the world around him as well. I love how they made the ocean look so real for an animated movie as well. Very realistic. I feel all the actors did an amazing job but my favorite was Ellen.Her Dory was great.All of the characters were great to be honest. I loved them all. Another of my favorites was Mr.Ray. He wasn't around a lot but when he was he was a great presence on the screen. The dentist was hilarious as well as the tank friends. I think Dory is my favorite character. There are so many good things about this movie yet I'm having a hard time naming them all. The way the story was told way very well done. It flowed nicely and fit together perfectly. Not once did something feel out of place from scene to scene.

Title: The best movie for a long time.
Review:
Finding Nemo is the best movie i have seen since The Lion King. I'm only young and even though my 7 year old sister thinks its a kids movie i think its for all ages. It includes lots of different lines, comments and music from a range of different movies and the humour in it is very humorous for 4 year old kids through to 4000 yr old people.Andrew Stanton has done an excellent job in directing this hit. Another thing i absolutely love about it is the casters didn't choose the popular celebrities but used people who i never knew before this. They gave the chance of being famous and well known to people who are usually just stuck behind the scenes of movies. They used a range of different fish that fit into different stereotypes in our communities and our own lives in the modern times. Finding Nemo as well as Shrek and Shrek 2 are some of the most awesome movies that have being put out in the last decade.

Review:
i know that i'm super late to the party, but this is one of the handful of movies that i grew up watching. maybe i'm biased to Disney/pixar movies, but finding nemo is just one of those films i can keep coming back to. if i'm in a bad mood, i can pop the disc into the DVD player with a sweet tea and some popcorn and relax. am i the only one who feels this way?

And the voices are cast perfectly as well...like the voice of Willem Dafoe for Gill, for example...a perfect choice. The character of Dory ( speaks through the voice of Ellen DeGeneres ) steals the show. She's an adorable blue fish who suffers from amnesia. She forgets what she's doing or going to every five minutes and that really leads to hilarious situations.

Movies like this aren't just being made for children exclusive... They're good for everyone to realize you have to entertain yourself from time to time and just to enjoy the little things in life. I recommend this to everyone in the world. No matter if you're 9 or 99 years old, Finding Nemo will bring a smile on your face and leave behind a warm feeling in your heart.

Title: Finding Nemo - Part Deux
Review:
The current range of Penguins in the films - I'm surprised that the artists / production crew didn't beat France to the punch on Penguins March.

Why? If they visited Melbourne just a short flight from Sydney they would have found a follow on - "March of the Littlest Penguin" that brings spectators from around the world to watch as these little guys travel off the coast and back bringing food to their young. Evil Gulls, predators, and plot line suggests a movie option next time.

If not try a web search using "Grand Penguin Parade" while enjoy the wave after wave of penguins returning.
